page.title: 08BIDDISHAM CHURCH
page.content: IT IS UNUSUAL TO FIND A CHURCH WHOSE SIVE REFLECTS THE SIZE OF THE COMMUNITY,THIS DOES APPLY TO THE CHURCH OF SAINT JOHNS AT BIDDISHAM.IT IS SITUATED IN THE CENTRE OF THE STRAGGLING VILLAGE ON A ROAD WHICH LEADS NOWHERE. THE CHURCH HAS OBVIOUSLY BEEN BUILT IN STAGES,MOSTLY OF LOCAL LIMESTONE.THE LOWER PART OF THE TOWER AND THE CHANCEL ARCH DATE FROM THE THIRTEENTH CENTURY.THE REMAINDER WAS BUILT IN 1860. THE CHURCH WILL SEAT ABOUT A HUNDRED PEOPLE.THE WALLS ARE WHITE,CONTRASTING WITH THE BROWN WOOD OF THE ROOF. IT IS A PLEASING BUILDING WHICH IS OBVIOUSLY WELL USED.
